G. 2, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11872.2" n="b" level="4"> In an expression of displeasure: <cit><quote lang="la">in' hinc, quo dignus, cum donis tuis Tam lepidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11872.3" n="B" level="2"> In a designation of time with which some action concurs: <cit><quote lang="la">egone abs te abii hinc hodie cum diluculo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 121</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum primo luci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras cum filio cum primo luci ibo hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primā luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primo lumine solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 130</bibl></cit>: cum primo mane, Auct. B. Afr. 62: cum mane, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 372</bibl> P: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter cum ortu solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter cum occasu solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 68:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 68, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sole reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 568</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mane cum luci simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; v. simul: exiit cum nuntio (i. e. <hi rend="ital">at the same time with</hi>, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 46</bibl>; cf.: cum his nuntius Romam ad consulendum redit ( = <foreign lang="greek">a(/ma toi=sde</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul cum dono designavit templo Jovis fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et vixisse cum re publicā pariter, et cum illā simul extinctus esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11872.4" n="C" level="2"> In designating the relations, circumstances, way, and manner with which any act is connected, by which it is accompanied, under or in which it takes place, etc., <hi rend="ital">with, in, under, in the midst of, among, to, at</hi>: aliquid cum malo suo facere, Plaut. <cb n="CUM" /> Bacch. 3, 4, 4; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magnā calamitate et prope pernicie civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum summā rei publicae salute et cum tuā peste ac pernicie cumque eorum exitio, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magno provinciae periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum summo probro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: cum summo terrore hominum, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum summā tuā dignitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:22:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 22, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bonā alite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferendum hoc onus est cum labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis cum lacrimis aliquem obsecrare,</quote> <trans><tr>amid many tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ipsum abstulit magno cum gemitu civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:19:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 19, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orare cum lacrimis coepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si minus cum curā aut cautelā locus loquendi lectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit> Ritschl; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum curā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:39:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 39, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 42, 5</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum summo studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quanto studio periculoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 25, 12 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multā venustate et omni sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā cum celeritate ad exercitum rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:52" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximo cum clamore involant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum clamore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 45, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum clamore ac tumultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 31, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses cum silentio auditi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 35, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud cum pace agemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:29:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 29, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bonā pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 24, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bonā gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bonā veniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum veniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:104" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum virtute vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum firmā memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legata cum fide ac sine calumniā persolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia in aede ... cum sollemni dedicatione dono fixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11872.5" n="b" level="4"> Attributively, with <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et huic proelium cum Tuscis ad Janiculum erat crimini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti cum summā caritate inopia erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 29, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11872.6" n="2" level="3"> Cum eo quod, ut, or ne (in an amplification or limitation), <hi rend="ital">with the circumstance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the regard that, on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under the condition, with the exception, that</hi>, etc. (except once in Cic. epistt. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n11872.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Cum eo quod, with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 47</bibl> Spald.; 10, 7, 13; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo quidem, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit sane, quoniam ita tu vis: sed tamen cum eo, credo, quod sine peccato meo fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11872.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antium nova colonia missa cum eo, ut Antiatibus permitteretur, si et ipsi adscribi coloni vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 22</bibl>.—So with <hi rend="ital">tamen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo tamen, ut nullo tempore is ... non sit sustinendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n11872.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequar voluntati tuae cum eo, ne dubites, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo, ne amplius quam has urant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 22</bibl></cit>; and with <hi rend="ital">tamen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo tamen, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11872.10" n="3" level="3"> Cum dis volentibus, etc., <hi rend="ital">with God's help, by the will of the gods</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">su\n qew=|</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum divis volentibus quodque bene eveniat mando tibi, Mani, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 1</bibl></cit>: volentibu' cum magnis dis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agite, cum dis bene juvantibus arma capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum superis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Stil. III. p. 174</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11872.11" n="4" level="3"> Cum with an ordinal number (cum octavo, cum decimo, etc.) for our <hi rend="ital">-fold</hi>, in economical lang., of the multiplication of cultivated products: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex eodem semine aliubi cum decimo redeat, aliubi cum quinto decimo,</quote> <trans><tr>ten-, fifteenfold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum octavo, cum decimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum centesimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 21, § 95</bibl></cit>; cf. with a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum centesimā fruge agricolis faenus reddente terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11872.12" n="D" level="2"> With a means or instrument, considered as attending or accompanying the actor in his action (so most freq. anteclass., or in the poets and scientific writers): acribus inter se cum armis confligere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 261, 6</bibl>: effundit voces proprio cum pectore, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 424</bibl>: cum voce maximā conclamat, Claud. Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum linguā lingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:98:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 98, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suo gurgite accepit venientem (fluvius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:816" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 816</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vino et oleo ungere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">terra in Augurum libris scripta cum R uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 21</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense><sense id="n11872.13" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11872.14" n="A" level="2"> Completing the meaning of verbs. </sense><sense id="n11872.15" n="1" level="3"> With verbs of union, connection, and agreement: cum veteribus <cb n="CUM" /> copiis se conjungere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut proprie cohaereat cum narratione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(haec) arbitror mihi constare cum ceteris scriptoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interfectam esse ... convenit mihi cum adversariis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:22:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 22, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī autem poterat in gratiam redire cum Oppianico Cluentius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 31, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc sententiam cum virtute congruere semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera quibus etiam cum hoste devincitur fides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 31, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capita nominis Latini stare ac sentire cum rege videbant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 52, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo in gratiam redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 58, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabat cum eo senatūs majestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurasse cum Pausaniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Autronium secum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 13, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. also conecto, colligo, consentio, compono, etc.—</sense><sense id="n11872.16" n="2" level="3"> Of companionship, association, sharing, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum his me oblecto, qui res gestas aut orationes scripserunt suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam vivitur, non cum perfectis hominibus, sed cum iis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla (societas) carior quam ea quae cum re publicā est unicuique nostrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum civibus vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum M. Fabio mihi summus usus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quibus publice privatimque hospitia amicitiasque junxerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partiri cum Dinaeā matre jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Baebio communicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of local association, nearness: cum mortuā jugulatum servum nudum positurum ait,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duos tamen pudor cum eo tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11872.17" n="3" level="3"> Of intercourse, traffic, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to deal with</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 35, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo Accius injuriarum agit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si par est agere cum civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 22, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 10, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi cum Peripateticis res esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 35, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum enim mihi res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uni tibi et cum singulis res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem cum Sabinis facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 30, 109</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: agere cum aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to have a lawsuit with</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 114</bibl> et saep.; v. ago, II. B. 8. a., and II. B. 9.; consisto, I. B. 5.; cf. also pango, etc.—</sense><sense id="n11872.18" n="4" level="3"> Of deliberation and discussion: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ego cum ipsis philosophis disserebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus cum conjuratis consultando absumunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.; v. also cogito, reputo, dubito, etc.—</sense><sense id="n11872.19" n="5" level="3"> Of strife, difference, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibuscum continenter bellum gerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Cleanthe quam multis rebus Chrysippus dissidet!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tam quererer cum deo quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quo Antiochum saepe disputantem audiebam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum stomacheretur cum Metello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:66:267" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 66, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu cum hoste confligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 23, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilia cum honestis pugnare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: cum Catone dissentire. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum majoribus nostris bella gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 19, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 22, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Auruncis bellum inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Volscis aequo Marte discessum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 40, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias cum Africano gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Scipione dissentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum utrāque (uxore) divortium fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl></cit>; cf. also certo, pugno, discrepo, differo, distraho, dissentio, etc.—</sense><sense id="n11872.20" n="6" level="3"> Of comparison: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Arcesilae calumnia conferenda est cum Democriti verecundiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc rationem dicendi cum imperatoris laude comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferam Sullamne cum Junio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(orationem) cum magnitudine utilitatis comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11872.21" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., implying the notion of being furnished, endowed, clothed with any thing, or of possessing, holding, suffering under, etc., in a lit. and trop. sense: ille vir haud magnā cum re sed plenus fidei, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 1</bibl> (cf. the antith.: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem sine re, sine fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 78</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">a portu illuc nunc cum laternā advenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadus cum vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olla cum aquā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcula cum ornamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiscos cum pecuniā Siciliensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerariae naves cum commeatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 24, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum servili schemā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 117</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of clothing,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 13, § 31</bibl>; <pb n="490" /> <cb n="CUM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 34, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:94" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 94</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne quis cum telo servus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of weapons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inmissi cum falcibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi argenteum Cupidinem cum lampade,</quote> <trans><tr>holding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum Cereris cum faucibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 49</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">109: cum elephanti capite puer natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quinque pedibus natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 4, 14 al.</bibl>: omnia cum pulchris animis Romana juventus, Enn. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Ter. ib.: Minucius cum vulnere gravi relatus in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:44:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 44, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te Romam venisse cum febri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 62, 175</bibl>: cum eisdem suis vitiis nobilissimus, <hi rend="ital">with all his faults</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in spite of</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 40, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eis qui cum imperio sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit> Manut.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum imperio aut magistratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 12</bibl></cit> Bremi; v. imperium.—</sense><sense id="n11872.22" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">idem</hi> (never of the identity of two subjects, but freq. of the relation of two subjects to the same object, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 538): tibi mecum in eodem est pistrino vivendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandoque tu ... omnibus in eisdem flagitiis mecum versatus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80:section=187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidae ... in eādem mecum Africā geniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 28, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11872.23" n="D" level="2"> In the adverb. phrase, cum primis, <hi rend="ital">with the foremost</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">especially, particularly</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:224" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 224</bibl>.—Post-class. also as one word: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cumprīmis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:7 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 7 al.</bibl>!*? </sense><sense id="n11872.24" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Cum</hi> in anastrophe. So always with the <hi rend="ital">pers. pron.</hi>: mecum, tecum, secum, nobiscum, etc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 154</bibl>; Prisc. pp. 949 and 988 P.; and in gen. with the <hi rend="ital">rel. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocum (quīcum), quacum, quibuscum, quīcum (for quocum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 31</bibl>, §§ 76 and 77; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 35, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:7" default="NO">10, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:38" default="NO">11, 2, 38</bibl>. But where cum is emphatic, or a demonstrative <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> is understood, cum is placed before the <hi rend="ital">rel.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">his de rebus velim cum Pompeio, cum Camillo, cum quibus vobis videbitur, consideretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibuit sibi quindecim principes cum quibus causas cognovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11872.25" n="b" level="4"> Before et ... et, connecting two <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et diurno et nocturno metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n11872.26" n="III" level="1"> In compounds the primitive form <hi rend="ital">com</hi> was alone in use, and was unchanged before <hi rend="ital">b, p, m</hi>: comburo, compono, committo, and a few words beginning with vowels: comes, comitium, and comitor; <hi rend="ital">m</hi> was assimilated before <hi rend="ital">r</hi>: corripio; often before <hi rend="ital">l</hi>: colligo or conligo; rarely before <hi rend="ital">n</hi>, as connumero, but usually dropped: conecto, conitor, conubium; with the change of <hi rend="ital">m</hi> into <hi rend="ital">n</hi> before all the remaining consonants: concutio, condono, confero, congero, conqueror, consumo, contero, convinco; so, conjicio, etc., but more usually conicio; and with the rejection of <hi rend="ital">m</hi> before vowels and before <hi rend="ital">h</hi>: coarguo, coëo, coinquino, coopto, cohibeo.—</sense><sense id="n11872.27" n="B" level="2"> It designates, </sense><sense id="n11872.28" n="1" level="3"> A being or bringing together of several objects: coëo, colloquor, convivor, etc.: colligo, compono, condo, etc.—</sense><sense id="n11872.29" n="2" level="3"> The completeness, perfecting of any act, and thus gives intensity to the signif. of the simple word, as in commaculo, commendo, concito, etc., comminuo, concerpo, concido, convello, etc.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11873" type="main" key="Cum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cum</orth> (ante-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">quom</orth>; freq. in MSS. of Cicero; the post-class. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">quum</orth> is incorrectly given in many MSS. and edd.), <sense id="n11873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [pronom. stem ka- or kva- with <case>acc.</case> case ending]. </sense><sense id="n11873.1" n="I" level="1"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">when, as, while</hi>, sometimes = <hi rend="ital">after, since</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11873.2" n="A" level="2"> In adverbial clauses dependent on non-preterite predicates. </sense><sense id="n11873.3" n="1" level="3"> The time designated by cum being indefinite, <hi rend="ital">when, if, whenever</hi>, always with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, except in the instances A. 2. </sense><sense id="n11873.4" n="a" level="4"> Cum with <hi rend="ital">pres. indic.</hi>, often equivalent to si. </sense><sense id="n11873.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam omnes id faciunt quom se amari intellegunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. prol. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile, quom valemus, recta consilia aegrotis damus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum semen maturum habet, tum tempestiva est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">41</bibl>: quid? tum cum es iratus, permittis illi iracundiae <cb n="CUM" /> dominationem animi tui? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum permagna praemia sunt, est causa peccandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 20, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:23:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 23, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam vivere tunc incipiunt cum desinendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 23, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ad cujus igitur fidem confugiet cum per ejus fidem laeditur cui se commiserit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 208</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With principal predicate in logical <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">haud invito ad auris sermo mi accessit tuos, Quom te postputasse omnis res prae parente intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum levati morbo videntur, in eum de integro inciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(dolor) Cum furit ... Profuit incensos aestus avertere ( = prodest),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo non, cum alteri prodest, sibi profuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 81, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 435</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 288</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.8" n="b" level="4"> With logical <hi rend="ital">perf. indic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> (very freq.), the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> translated either by English <hi rend="ital">pres. perf.</hi> or by <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi>: omnia sunt incerta cum a jure discessum est, <hi rend="ital">when we</hi> (<hi rend="ital">once</hi>) <hi rend="ital">disregard the law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernatores cum exultantes loligines viderunt ... tempestatem significari putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:70:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 70, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum depulsi sunt agni a matribus, diligentia adhibenda est ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ejus generis copia defecit, ad innocentium supplicia descendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hostis) cum intravit ... modum a captivis non accipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia enim, cum prima cognovi, jungere extrema cupio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:33:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 33, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 26, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 24, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 10</bibl> prooem.; 9, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:21:9" default="NO">21, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 13:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Helv. 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:122" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:14" default="NO">10, 7, 14</bibl>.—In oblique clauses the <hi rend="ital">perf. indic.</hi> may remain, or may be changed into <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi>, even after preterites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With two logical <hi rend="ital">perff.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum id factum est, tamen grex dominum non mutavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum se disposuit ... summum bonum tetigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 17:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 17, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 1, 1, 5</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11873.12" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.13" n="(a)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fere officia reperientur, cum quaeretur, quid deceat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 34, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12, 17</bibl>.— So with principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">fut. imper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam tum cum verisimile erit aliquem commisisse ... latratote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 57</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 19, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.14" n="(b)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in talibus ... stabilitas amicitiae confirmari potest, cum homines cupiditatibus imperabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 8</bibl> prooem.—</sense><sense id="n11873.15" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.16" n="(a)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (spem), cum in otium venerimus, habere volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec irascimur illis cum sessorem recusaverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Marc. 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.17" n="(b)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">fut. indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haec erunt considerata, statim nostrae legis expositione ... utemur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum viderit secari patrem suum filiumve, vir bonus non flebit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—In oblique clauses, dependent on preterites, it is changed to the <hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tum demum beatum terrarum orbem futurum praedicavit cum aut sapientes regnare, aut reges sapere coepissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 4.—</sense><sense id="n11873.18" n="(g)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">fut. imper.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tempestates pluviae fuerint, videtote quot dies, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; 38.—</sense><sense id="n11873.19" n="(d)" level="5"> With two <hi rend="ital">fut. perff.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bene cesserit negotiatio, multum militia retulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 10:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.20" n="e" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11873.21" n="(a)" level="5"> In definitions with <hi rend="ital">pres, indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humile genus est (causae) cum contempta res adfertur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purgatio est cum factum conceditur, culpa removetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: maxima est capitis deminutio cum aliquis simul et civitatem et libertatem amittit, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12, 17</bibl>; 4, 53, 66 et saep. —</sense><sense id="n11873.22" n="(b)" level="5"> Etiam cum (less freq. cum etiam), <hi rend="ital">even when</hi> (nearly = etiamsi), always with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> if dependent on other than preterite predicates. (1) With <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi>: qui cavet ne decipiatur, vix cavet, quom etiam cavet, <cb n="CUM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo scelere, etiam cum multae causae convenisse ... videntur, tamen non temere creditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui incolunt maritimas urbis, etiam cum manent corpore, animo tamen excursant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 6</bibl>.—(2) With <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam cum potentes nocere intendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 4, 1</bibl></cit>. —(3) With <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum etiam plus contenderimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 13, 3</bibl>.—(4) In oblique clauses with <hi rend="ital">imperf. subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:Tog. Cand. 15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. Tog. Cand. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.23" n="(g)" level="5"> Anteclass. with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> in addressing indefinite persons in rules, after <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorba in sapā cum vis condere, arida facias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— Always with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> if a certain person is addressed; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 59</bibl> (l. A. 1. a. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> supra); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 18, § 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.24" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> referring to indefinite time. </sense><sense id="n11873.25" n="a" level="4"> With the <hi rend="ital">2d pers. sing.</hi>, used in an indefinite sense (<hi rend="ital">you</hi> = <hi rend="ital">one, any one</hi>). </sense><sense id="n11873.26" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbum'st pro benefactis quom mali messim metas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom faciem videas, videtur esse quantivis preti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 7</bibl> and 8 et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">difficile est tacere cum doleas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam interpretatio nominis habet acumen cum ad ridiculum convertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:63:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 63, 257</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 64, 259</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 67, 269</bibl>; 2, 75, 305; 3, 38, 156; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 75, 4</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11873.27" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficile est cum praestare omnibus concupieris, servare aequitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (versus) cum cantu spoliaveris, nuda paene remanet oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:55:183" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 55, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:47:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 47, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:51:24" default="NO" valid="yes">51, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:58:16" default="NO" valid="yes">58, 16</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11873.28" n="b" level="4"> In the jurists, in a clause exemplifying a general rule: cum ergo ita scriptum sit Heres Titius esto, addicere debemus, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 165</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 97</bibl>; 3, 161; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 31, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.29" n="c" level="4"> In the phrase audio cum dicat (I. F. 1, b. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">saepe soleo audire Roscium cum ita dicat se, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.30" n="d" level="4"> When, after cum, an imperfect or pluperfect is used as a logical tense (post-Aug.): non tulit gratis qui cum rogasset accepit, <hi rend="ital">who has asked for the favor, and</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:2:3:1" default="NO">2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:2:13:2" default="NO">2, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 86, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.31" n="e" level="4"> If the principal predicate is a potential subjunctive, an indefinite clause with a present or future after cum is always in the same mood: <cit><quote lang="la">caveto quom ventus siet aut imber, effodias aut seras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tam dissoluto animo est qui, haec cum videat, tacere ac neglegere possit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:39:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 39, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:55:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 55, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:4:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 4, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 51, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 32, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.32" n="3" level="3"> Of definite time, always with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> (for exceptions, v. 4. infra), <hi rend="ital">when, if, while</hi> (for the distinction between cum and si, cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">formam mihi totius rei publicae, si jam es Romae, aut cum eris, velim mittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si prodierit, atque adeo cum prodierit—scio enim proditurum esse—audiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:25:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 25, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si damnatus eris, atque adeo cum damnatus eris—nam dubitatio quae poterit esse? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:29:section=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 29, § 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:75:304" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 75, 304</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 10</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n11873.33" n="a" level="4"> Cum with <hi rend="ital">pres. indic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.34" n="(a)" level="5"> Principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe, edepol, quom illum contemplo et formam cognosco meam ... nimis simili'st mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 288</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 45</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Ne fle. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Non queo Quom te video, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestne tibi ulla spes salutis ostendi cum recordaris in deos immortalis quam impius ... fueris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>: cum hoc vereor, et cupio tibi ... parcere, rursus immuto voluntatem meam ( = <hi rend="ital">while</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 95</bibl>; Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem cum ... recordor, vix aetatem Alexandri suffecturam fuisse reor ad unum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 10, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 46, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum ita est,</quote> <trans><tr>if this is so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:24:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 24, 58</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi ita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 5</bibl></cit>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">often, nunc cum: qui modo nusquam conparebas, nunc quom conpares, peris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 35</bibl>; 2, 2, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos de injusto rege nihil loquimur, nunc cum de ipsā regali re publicā quaerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 39, 7</bibl>.—So with logical <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> for the <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:122" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 122</bibl>.—But Cicero always uses nunc cum with a <hi rend="ital">subj</hi>. when the clause, while designating present time, generally <pb n="491" /> <cb n="CUM" /> in opposition to a former time, implies a reason for the principal action, <hi rend="ital">now that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi tum, cum res publica severitatem desiderabat, vici naturam, etc., nunc cum omnes me causae ad misericordiam ... vocent, quanto tandem studio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15, 35</bibl> (25); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 50</bibl>; not found in later writers, except in the Gallic panegyrists, e. g. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Grat. Act. 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n11873.35" n="(b)" level="5"> With principal predicate in the logical <hi rend="ital">perf., if</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Curculio hercle verba mihi dedit quom cogito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tandem, quom recogito, qui potis est scire, haec scire me?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.36" n="b" level="4"> Cum with logical <hi rend="ital">perf. indic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.37" n="(a)" level="5"> Principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo quom optume fecisti, nunc adest occasio Benefacta cumulare,</quote> <trans><tr>after doing excellently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: quo etiam major vir habendus est (Numa), cum illam sapientiam constituendae civitatis duobus prope saeculis ante cognovit, quam, etc. ( = siquidem, <hi rend="ital">if he has; seeing that he has</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 249</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11873.38" n="(b)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">at cumst imposta corona, Clamabis capiti vina subisse meo (est imposta = erit imposta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 30.—</sense><sense id="n11873.39" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.40" n="(a)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom videbis tum scies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. prol. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed cum certum sciam faciam te paulo ante certiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 30, 5</bibl>; 14, 3, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.41" n="(b)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tu haec leges, ego jam annuum munus confecero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.42" n="(g)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">imper. fut.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox quom imitabor Sauream, caveto ne succenseas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 59</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11873.43" n="(d)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (potential): <cit><quote lang="la">cum testes ex Siciliā dabo, quem volet ille eligat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22, § 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 10, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 17, 1</bibl> et saep.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) In oblique clauses, after preterites, changed into <hi rend="ital">imperf. subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 40</bibl>; after other tenses it is either changed into <hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi> or remains unchanged, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 56, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.44" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.45" n="(a)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox dabo quom ab re divinā rediero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 193</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haec docuero, tum illud ostendam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 59, 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 23, 5</bibl> et saep.—In oblique clauses, after preterites, the <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> is changed into <hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 30, 1</bibl>; after other tenses, and often in oblique oration, it remains unchanged, or is changed into <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 71, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 5, 2</bibl> dub.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:10" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 56, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.46" n="(b)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">imper</hi>. (almost always <hi rend="ital">fut. imper.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod quom dixero, si placuerit, Facitote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ego Granium testem produxero, refellito, si poteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:59:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 59, § 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 22</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">pres. imper.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 38, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.47" n="(g)" level="5"> With principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (potential): <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum omnia collegeris, tum ipse velim judices satisne videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 13, 41</bibl> dub.—In oblique clauses, after non-preterites, the <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> remains unchanged: <cit><quote lang="la">oro, ne me hodie, cum isti respondero, putetis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.48" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> in definite time. </sense><sense id="n11873.49" n="a" level="4"> Sometimes in oblique construction (3. c. <foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>; 3. d. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n11873.50" n="b" level="4"> Sometimes by attraction: <cit><quote lang="la">curata fac sint quom a foro redeam domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non admirere cum ego ipse me id ex te primum audisse confitear?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 24, 58</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11873.51" n="c" level="4"> In the semi-causal connection nunc cum, v. 3, a. <hi rend="ital">a fin.</hi> supra.</sense><sense id="n11873.52" n="B" level="2"> In adverbial anterior clauses dependent on preterite predicates, the time of the cum clause preceding that of the principal sentence (always with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, except in the instances mentioned 2.; 3. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>; and 5.), <hi rend="ital">when, after</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11873.53" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj.</hi> (so generally): quom socios nostros mandisset impius Cyclops, Liv. And. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 8, p. 817</bibl> (Lübbert conjectures, without sufficient reason, mandit sex): quom saucius multifariam ibi factus esset, tamen volnus <cb n="CUM" /> capiti nullum evenit, Cato, Orig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portisculus signum cum dare coepisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 234" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 234</bibl></cit> Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">quom testamento patris partisset bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:Com. Rel. v. 50" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> Com. Rel. v. 50</bibl></cit> Rib.: quem quom ibi vidissent Hortensius Postumiusque, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 241" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 241</bibl> Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0146,001:Com. Rel. v. 48" default="NO"><author>Turp.</author> Com. Rel. v. 48</bibl> Rib.; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 394, 27</bibl> (the MSS. reading: <cit><quote lang="la">quom venisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>, is corrupt): <cit><quote lang="la">audivi summos homines cum quaestor ex Macedoniā venissem Athenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum Crassus dixisset, silentium est consecutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Thebani Lacedaemonios bello superavissent ... aeneum statuerunt tropaeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 23, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius cum fanum Proserpinae Locris expilavisset, navigabat Syracusas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo cum venisset, animadvertit ad alteram ripam magnas esse copias hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinius et Tullia minor ... cum domos vacuas novo matrimonio fecissent, junguntur nuptiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 9</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n11873.54" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pluperf. indic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.55" n="a" level="4"> Ante-class. in place of the class. <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem me pridem quom ei advorsum veneram, Facere atriensem voluerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid ais? Quom intellexeras, id consilium capere, quor non dixti extemplo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.56" n="b" level="4"> If the pluperfect is a virtual imperfect, designating the time at which the main action took place, the principal predicate being likewise in the pluperfect, when the clause would require an indicative if placed in the imperfect (3. a. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>): exspectationem nobis non parvam adtuleras cum scripseras Varronem tibi confirmasse, etc. ( = exspectabam cum legebam; cf. C. 3, a. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>, 2.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 18, 1</bibl>; cf. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 2</bibl>, where the cum clause is relative; v.
