(ad populum) ita disseruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum maxime Capua circumvallaretur, Syracusarum oppugnatio ad finem venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 23, 1</bibl></cit>.—In a very few instances the <hi rend="ital">imperf. indic.</hi> occurs without apparent reason: an vero cum honos agebatur familiae vestrae ... succensuit<pb n="494" /> <cb n="CUM" />  pater tuus cum Sullam defenderent (probably to distinguish the two cum clauses), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 17, 49</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jus amicitiae, societatis, adfinitatis ageretur, cum, etc., eo tempore tu non modo non ... retulisti, sed ne ipse quidem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">ille versus, qui in te erat collatus cum aedilitatem petebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex oppido exportabatur (Dianae statua) quem conventum mulierum factum esse arbitramini? ... Quid hoc totā Siciliā est clarius quam omnes convenisse cum Diana exportaretur ex oppido? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 77</bibl></cit>.—Poets and post-class. writers frequently disregard the class. usage, the former by using either mood instead of the other, the latter by the un-Ciceronian use of the <hi rend="ital">subj.;</hi> v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5" default="NO">5</bibl> (4), 4, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 148</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 735</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:122" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:12:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 12, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:24" default="NO">9, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 5, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:22:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 1, 22, § 1</bibl>; Gell. strangely uses an <hi rend="ital">imperf. indic.</hi> where class. writers would use a <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ego, homines cum considerabam, alterum fidei, alterum probri plenum, nequaquam adduci potui ad absolvendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum secum reputavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n11873.87" n="D" level="2"> In adverbial clauses denoting identity of action (if the principal sentence and the clause with cum denote not different actions, but one action, which, expressed by the latter clause, is by the principal sentence defined in its meaning and import, the clause with cum always takes the <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, except once or twice post-class., and almost always the same tense as the principal sentence), <hi rend="ital">when, by, in</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11873.88" n="1" level="3"> The predicate in present: <cit><quote lang="la">amice facis Quom me laudas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 16</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">bene facitis cum venitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum taces, nulla esse concedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">21, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 47, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6, 5</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11873.89" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum igitur proferent aliquid hujusmodi ... inventum proferent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:40:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 40, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 39, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.90" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum dederis, illud dederis ut is absolvatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 12, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 30, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.91" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecisti furtum quom istaec flagitia me celavisti et patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 18</bibl> (22); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 32</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">loco ille motus est cum ex urbe est depulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:23:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 23, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 49, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7</bibl>, ext. 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 47</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11873.92" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">histor. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orestes cum se defendit, in matrem confert crimen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 15, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.93" n="6" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum grandiorem aetatem ad consulatum constituebant, adulescentiae temeritatem verebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 33, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 15</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11873.94" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Imperf.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): quid quod et ominibus certis prohibebar amori Indulgere meo, tum cum mihi ferre jubenti Excidit et fecit spes nostras cera caducas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:595 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 595 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.95" n="8" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">exspectationem nobis non parvam attuleras cum scripseras, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 16, 37</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n11873.96" n="9" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pluperf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quidem tibi ostenderam cum a me Capuam reiciebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, D, 5.—</sense><sense id="n11873.97" n="10" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Imperf. subj.</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tunc venena edebat bibebatque, cum immensis epulis non delectaretur tantum, sed gloriaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 10:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.98" n="11" level="3"> Often relatively added to nouns when a relative clause must be supplied: <cit><quote lang="la">illa scelera ... cum ejus domum evertisti, cujus, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>which you committed when (by)</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 17, 9</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n11873.99" n="E" level="2"> In relative clauses, = quo tempore, quo, etc. </sense><sense id="n11873.100" n="1" level="3"> Dependent on nouns designating time, the mood follows the general rules of relative clauses. </sense><sense id="n11873.101" n="a" level="4"> The principal sentence is a formal statement of indefinite time, with the copula (tempus fuit cum, or fuit cum, analogous to sunt qui, etc.); generally with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, but sometimes <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, when sunt qui would take this mood. </sense><sense id="n11873.102" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fut. indic.</hi>: nunc est profecto (i. e. tempus), interfici quom perpeti me possum (the ante-class. writers construe sunt qui <cb n="CUM" /> with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam aderit tempus quom sese etiam ipse oderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.103" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi>: nunc est ille dies quom gloria maxima sese nobis ostendat, si vivimus, sive morimur, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 10, p. 880</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 383 Vahl.); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit illud profecto tempus et illucescet aliquando dies cum ... amicissimi benevolentiam desideres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 25, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.104" n="(g)" level="5"> With preterites, <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit quoddam tempus cum in agris homines bestiarum more vagabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fuerunt alia genera qui ... dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 62</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">fuit cum hoc dici poterat (potuisset would be hypothetical),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11873.105" n="(d)" level="5"> With preterites, <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fuit tempus cum rura colerent homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac fuit cum mihi quoque initium requiescendi concessum arbitrarer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.106" n="b" level="4"> Attributively with nouns denoting time (tempus, dies, etc.), in ordinary sentences. </sense><sense id="n11873.107" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fut. indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidunt saepe tempora cum ea commutantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum illud tempus cum non ero, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:69:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 69, § 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 84</bibl>.—With potential <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.108" n="(b)" level="5"> With past tenses, <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 91</bibl>; id. rud. 2, 6, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ille eo tempore paruit cum parere senatui necesse erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memini noctis illius cum ... pollicebar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 42, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 35, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 18, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:22:5" default="NO">1, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 23, 2</bibl> et saep.—So with nouns implying time: <cit><quote lang="la">illa pugna quom, etc. ( = in quā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Marcellino Consule, cum ego ... putabam ( = anno Marcellini, quo, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrum nostrorum memoriā cum exercitus videbatur ( = tempore quo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.109" n="(g)" level="5"> With preterites in <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepit enim agrum iis temporibus cum jacerent pretia praediorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:19:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 19, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerandus est ille annus cum obmutuisset senatus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 12, 26</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 65, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec scripsi postridie ejus diei cum castra haberem Mopsuhestiae (cf. habebam, as epistolary tense),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—If the clause does not define the noun, but is a co-ordinate designation of time, it follows the rule of adverbial clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem anno, cum omnia infida Romanis essent, Capuae quoque conjurationes factae,</quote> <trans><tr>while</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 36, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 41, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.110" n="c" level="4"> Appositively added to temporal adverbs and to dates (heri, hodie, medius, tertius, olim, antea, quondam, nuper, olim, postea) following the rules of adverbial clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassus hodie, cum vos non adessetis, posuit idem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae a te nudius tertius dicta sunt, cum docere velles, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:48:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 48, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:39:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 39, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 17</bibl> et saep.—So with dates (always <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>. except with cum haec scribebam, or dabam): <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam Pompeius apud populum ad VIII. Id. Febr., cum pro Milone diceret, clamore convicioque jactatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, b, 1; 3, 3, 1; 3, 4, 1; 4, 2, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 19, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.111" n="2" level="3"> The principal sentence defines a period of time during which the action of the clause has or had lasted, always with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, and after the words defining the period, = per quod tempus, <hi rend="ital">when, that, during which, while</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11873.112" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi>, = Engl. <hi rend="ital">pres. perf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.113" n="(a)" level="5"> With cardinal, definite or indefinite. (1) Time in <case>acc.</case> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc domum Jam multos annos est quom possideo,</quote> <trans><tr>that I have been the owner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 37</bibl>.—(2) Time in <hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni sunt octo cum ista causa in istā meditatione versatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 30, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:171" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 51, 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 36, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.114" n="(b)" level="5"> With ordinals: <cit><quote lang="la">vigesimus annus est, cum omnes scelerati me unum petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 627</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 646</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.115" n="(g)" level="5"> With diu: <cit><quote lang="la">jam diu'st quom ventri victum non datis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:25:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 25, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.116" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Perf.</hi> with negation,<cb n="CUM" />  the principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> or logical <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, = Engl. <hi rend="ital">pres. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia septem menses sunt quom in hasce aedes pedem Nemo intro tetulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8, 33</bibl> (2, 16, 33. —</sense><sense id="n11873.117" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi>, the principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulti jam anni erant cum inter patricios magistratus tribunosque nulla certamina fuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 33, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.118" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi>, the principal predicate in <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies triginta aut plus in ea navi fui, Quom interea semper mortem exspectabam miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus et alter dies intercesserat, cum res parum certa videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.119" n="3" level="3"> The principal sentence specifying a period of time which has or had elapsed since the action took place, = ex ejus tempore, <hi rend="ital">since</hi> or <hi rend="ital">after</hi>, always with <hi rend="ital">indic.;</hi> the principal predicate <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> or logical <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, cum with <hi rend="ital">perf. indic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.120" n="a" level="4"> With cardinals. </sense><sense id="n11873.121" n="(a)" level="5"> Time in <case>acc.</case> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">annos factum'st sedecim Quom conspicatus est primo crepusculo Puellam exponi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 39</bibl></cit>; so probably <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.122" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum centum et decem anni sunt cum de pecuniis repetundis lata lex est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 11</bibl>, A, 2.— </sense><sense id="n11873.123" n="b" level="4"> With diu or dudum: <cit><quote lang="la">nam illi quidem haut sane diu'st quom dentes exciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.124" n="c" level="4"> Peculiarly, cum referring to an action which was <hi rend="ital">to be done</hi> after a period of time, <hi rend="ital">before, at the end of which</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino biduum supererat cum exercitui frumentum metiri oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11873.125" n="4" level="3"> In inverted clauses, the principal sentence determining the time of the clause, cum ( = quo tempore) having the force of a relative; cum with the <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> always following the principal sentence; never in oblique discourse; very freq. in class. and post-class. writings (ante-class. only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 5</bibl>); principal sentence often with jam, vix, vixdum, nondum, tantum quod, and commodum; cum often with subito, repente, sometimes interim, tamen, etiamtum. </sense><sense id="n11873.126" n="a" level="4"> Principal sentence defining time by temporal expressions. </sense><sense id="n11873.127" n="(a)" level="5"> Principal sentence with <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> (1) Cum with <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">histor. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies nondum decem intercesserant cum ille alter filius necatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:21:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 21, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 715</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:91:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 91, 1</bibl>.—(2) Cum with <hi rend="ital">histor. inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 98:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 98, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.128" n="(b)" level="5"> Principal sentence with <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> (1) Cum with <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">histor. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum lucebat cum Ameriae scitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 59, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 1, 1</bibl>; 9, 33, 3; 9, 37, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 340</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:6 al" default="NO">5, 12, 6 al.</bibl>—(2) Cum with <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.129" n="(g)" level="5"> Principal sentence with <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, cum with <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies haud multi intercesserunt cum ex Leontinis praesidium ... venerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 29, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 48, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.130" n="b" level="4"> Principal sentence not containing expressions of time; most freq. with <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> in principal sentence, and <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">histor. pres.</hi> in clause with cum, but (far more rarely) many other combinations occur. </sense><sense id="n11873.131" n="(a)" level="5"> Principal sentence with <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi>, cum with <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitabat Minucius quin, etc., cum repente jubetur dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:29:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 29, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque hoc facere noctu adparabant cum matres familiae repente ... procucurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36, 1</bibl> (57 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 36</bibl> (26 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:28:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl> (31 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl> (19 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 24, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.132" n="(b)" level="5"> Principal sentence with <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi>, cum with <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">histor. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam Sora capta erat cum consules primā luce advenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24, 13</bibl></cit> (32 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9, 28</bibl> (14 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 586</bibl> (13 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 19</bibl> (13 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl> (18 times). —And cum with potential <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix erat hoc plane imperatum cum illum spoliatum ... videres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.133" n="(g)" level="5"> Principal sentence with <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 37, 39</bibl> (5 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 46, 3</bibl> (8 times).—</sense><sense id="n11873.134" n="(d)" level="5"> Principal sentence with <hi rend="ital">histor. inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:1" default="NO">9, 5, 1</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Principal sentence with <hi rend="ital">histor. pres.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32, 1</bibl> (3 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 695</bibl> (5 times).—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Cum with <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 17</bibl> (3 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 26</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) Cum with <pb n="495" /> <cb n="CUM" /> <hi rend="ital">histor. inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 31</bibl> (6 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 9</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) Cum with <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 46, 3</bibl> (3 times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 581</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:256 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 256 sq.</bibl>—（<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) With logical <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, or logical <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quam multi enim jam oratores commemorati sunt ... cum tamen spisse ad Antonium Crassumque pervenimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 36, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque fuga timidum caput abdidit alte (coluber), Cum medii nexus extremaeque agmina caudae Solvuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 422</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.135" n="5" level="3"> In clauses added loosely or parenthetically to a preceding clause or to a substantive in it (the mood governed by the rules for relative clauses). </sense><sense id="n11873.136" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">When, on an occasion, on which</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11873.137" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">perf. indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortensium maxime probavi pro Messalā dicentem, cum tu abfuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:328" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 96, 328</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">53, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:75:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 75, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 9</bibl> (1, 13, 19).—</sense><sense id="n11873.138" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">imperf. indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">num infitiari potes te illo ipso die meis praesidiis circumclusum commovere te non potuisse, cum tu nostrā ... caede contentum esse dicebas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:63:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 63, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 24, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.139" n="(g)" level="5"> Cum with <hi rend="ital">pres. indic.</hi>, a past tense in principal sentence (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nox erat et placidum carpebant fessa soporem Corpora ... cum medio volvuntur sidera lapsu, Cum tacet omnis ager, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 522</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 407</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.140" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Imperf. subj.</hi>: qui ... accensi nullā deinde vi sustineri potuere, cum compulsi in castra Romani rursus obsiderentur, <hi rend="ital">in consequence of which</hi> ( = ita ut), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 8</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) So freq. cum quidem, always with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed uterque noster cedere cogebatur, cum quidem ille pollicitus est, se quod velletis esse facturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 22, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34, 83</bibl> and 84; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ael. Ver. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.141" n="b" level="4"> Cum tamen, <hi rend="ital">at which time however, and yet, while nevertheless</hi>, representing the principal sentence as concessive, analogous to qui tamen (v. tamen). </sense><sense id="n11873.142" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, like qui tamen, always, except for particular reasons: <cit><quote lang="la">fit gemitus omnium et clamor, cum tamen a praesenti supplicio tuo continuit populus Romanus se, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:29:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 29, § 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 513</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 62</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum nihilo magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; passing over into inverted cum clauses (4. b.), as <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 98:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 98, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 20, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.143" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 31, 6</bibl> (where the clause with cum is adverbial).—</sense><sense id="n11873.144" n="6" level="3"> Cum interea (interim). </sense><sense id="n11873.145" n="a" level="4"> Adverbial (rare). </sense><sense id="n11873.146" n="(a)" level="5"> Temporal with <hi rend="ital">subj.;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">subj. imperf., while</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl>; with <hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj., after</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 9</bibl>, § 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.147" n="(b)" level="5"> Adversative, with <hi rend="ital">subj., whereas during this time</hi>. (1) <hi rend="ital">Pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulat se eorum praesidio conflteri, cum interea aliud quiddam jam diu machinetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1, prol. 14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, prol. 14</bibl>.—(2) With <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tu interim vero numquam significaris sententiam tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 11</bibl> dub.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:8:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 8, 6</bibl>.—(3) With <hi rend="ital">imperf. subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:76:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 76, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.148" n="b" level="4"> Relative, always with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, in class. writings always referring to a period <hi rend="ital">during which</hi>, belonging, </sense><sense id="n11873.149" n="(a)" level="5"> To the attributive clauses (v. 2. supra). (1) In <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni sunt octo ... cum interea Cluentianae pecuniae vestigium nullum invenitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 30, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 33</bibl>.— (2) In <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 8</bibl> (2. c.).—</sense><sense id="n11873.150" n="(b)" level="5"> To the inverted clauses (4.): <cit><quote lang="la">tanta erat in his locis multitudo cum interim Rufio noster ... hominem percussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—So probably: cum interim Gallus quidam processit, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:92 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 38, 92 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:49:4" default="NO" valid="yes">49, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 37, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:7:2" default="NO">9, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:33:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 60</bibl>; with indefinite <hi rend="ital">pres. indic.</hi> in both terms, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 11:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Marc. 11, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.151" n="(g)" level="5"> To the additional clauses (5.). (1) With <hi rend="ital">perf. indic.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:69" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:33" default="NO">4, 12, 33</bibl>; with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> in oblique discourse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 51, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 27, 6</bibl>.—(2) Post-Aug., and in Nep., = cum tamen (5. b.), <hi rend="ital">while nevertheless, whereas</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perf. indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post Leuctricam pugnam Lacedaemonii se numquam refecerunt ... cum interim Agesilaus non destitit patriam juvare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: cum interim Oedipodis ossa ... colis, <cb n="CUM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3</bibl>, ext. 3; 3, 4, 5; 4, 4, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:11" default="NO">10, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:67" default="NO">12, 10, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:33" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 33</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n11873.152" n="F" level="1"> In clauses completing the idea of the governing verb. </sense><sense id="n11873.153" n="1" level="3"> After verbs of perception (videre, perspicere, audire, etc.; audivi cum diceres, etc. = audivi te dicentem). </sense><sense id="n11873.154" n="a" level="4"> Dependent on verbs of seeing and feeling. </sense><sense id="n11873.155" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ipsi vident eorum quom auferimus bona ( = nos auferre or auferentes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectum est cum obiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.156" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is ... numquam est conspectus cum veniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:59:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 59, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi ... Cum tu terga dares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 224</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.157" n="b" level="4"> After verbs of hearing, always with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Flaccum ego audivi cum diceret Caeciliam exisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 33, 144</bibl>; 2, 37, 155; 2, 90, 365; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 24, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.158" n="c" level="4"> After memini, with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> (sc. tempus): <cit><quote lang="la">memini quom ... haud audebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memini cum mihi desipere videbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 28, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memini cum velles residere ferventissimo sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.159" n="2" level="3"> After verba adfectuum, with the force of quod, always with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> (mostly ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n11873.160" n="a" level="4"> Verbs of thanking: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo gratiam tibi Quom copiam istam mi et potestatem facis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 84</bibl> (99); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi maximas gratias ago, cum tantum litterae meae potuerunt, ut eis lectis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 24, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.161" n="b" level="4"> Of congratulation: <cit><quote lang="la">quom tu's aucta liberis ... gratulor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 35</bibl>: L. Caesar, O mi Cicero, inquit, gratulor tibi cum tantum vales apud Dolabellam, etc., L. Caesar ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 3</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Att. 14, 17</bibl>, A, 3.—</sense><sense id="n11873.162" n="c" level="4"> Of rejoicing and grieving: <cit><quote lang="la">quom istaec res tibi ex sententiā Pulcre evenit, gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vero in C. Matii familiaritatem venisti, non dici potest quam valde gaudeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.163" n="d" level="4"> Dependent on optative sentences: <cit><quote lang="la">di tibi bene faciant semper quom advocatus bene mi ades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 19</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n11873.164" n="G" level="1"> Elliptical usages (without predicate). </sense><sense id="n11873.165" n="1" level="3"> Cum maxime. </sense><sense id="n11873.166" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: hanc Bacchidem Amabat, ut quom maxime, tum Pamphilus ( = ut amabat tum quom maxume amabat, <hi rend="ital">as much as he ever did</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamne ea neglegamus, quae fiunt cum maxime, quae videmus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 15, 32</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11873.167" n="b" level="4"> By abbreviation: nunc cum maxime or cum maxime alone, <hi rend="ital">now especially, just now</hi>: tum cum maxime, <hi rend="ital">just then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc cum maxume operis aliquid facere credo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae multos jam annos et nunc cum maxime filium interfectum cupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra amissa, et tum cum maxime ardere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 32, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 55:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 55, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:55:11" default="NO">55, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:81:7" default="NO">81, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37</bibl>; Eum. pro Schol. 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> 2</bibl>.—With maxime in adverbial clauses, <hi rend="ital">just while, especially when</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 13, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl>, a, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:59:7" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 59, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 25, 4</bibl>; 3, 31, 3; 4, 3, 1; 8, 33, 4 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11873.168" n="2" level="3"> Similarly with other superlatives (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">foliis ternis, aut, cum plurimum, quaternis,</quote> <trans><tr>at the utmost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 74, § 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:60" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 7, 10, § 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tardissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum longissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n11873.169" n="H" level="1"> For co-ordinate clauses with cum ... tum, v. tum, I. A. 3.</sense><sense id="n11873.170" n="II" level="1"> Causal, <hi rend="ital">since, because, as</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11873.171" n="A" level="2"> Anteclass., chiefly with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.172" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pres. indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc hic quidem homines tam brevem vitam colunt, Quom hasce herbas hujus modi in suom alvom congerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>because</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edepol, merito esse iratum arbitror, Quom apud te tam parva'st ei fides,</quote> <trans><tr>since</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.173" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">perf. indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim quom is me dignum quoi concrederet Habuit, me habere honorem ejus ingenio decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.174" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.175" n="a" level="4"> By construction of principal sentence: adeon, me fuisse fungum ut qui illi <cb n="CUM" /> crederem, Quom mi ipsum nomen ejus Clamaret, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.176" n="b" level="4"> Independent of such construction: <cit><quote lang="la">jam istoc probior es meo quidem animo quom in amore temperes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit> (bracketed by Goetz; <cit><quote lang="la">Brix conjectures temperas): nil miror si lubenter tu hic eras, Quom ego servos quando aspicio hunc lacrumem quia dijungimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 18</bibl></cit> Lorenz (Brix: quin ego ... lacrumo; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Lübbert, Grammat. Stud. II. pp. 133, 137): Nam puerum injussu eredo non tollent meo, Praesertim in eā re quom sit mi adjutrix socrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 82</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n11873.177" n="B" level="2"> Class. and post-class., always with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.178" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum istā sis auctoritate, non debes arripere maledictum ex trivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vita sine amicis insidiarum et metus plena sit, ratio ipsa monet amicitias comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum ita sint, videamus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum ita sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 21, 5</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11873.179" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inimicitiae fuerint numquam, opinio injuriae beneficiis sit exstincta ... rei publicae providebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 214</bibl>; the <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> is often retained after a principal predicate in a past tense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 60, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.180" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">imperf. subj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.181" n="a" level="4"> Denoting both cause and coincidence of time: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuum fundum, cum ego adessem, possidere non potuisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 29, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tanta multitudo lapides et tela conicerent, in muro consistendi potestas erat nulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 31, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 11, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.182" n="b" level="4"> Denoting cause without time: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset egens, sumptuosus, audax ... ad omnem fraudem versare suam mentem coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod oppidum cum esset altissimo et munitissimo loco, ad existimationem imperii arbitratus sum, comprimere eorum audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.183" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar cum constituisset hiemare in continenti, neque multum aestatis superesset, obsides imperat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n11873.184" n="C" level="2"> With adverbs of emphasis. </sense><sense id="n11873.185" n="1" level="3"> Praesertim cum, or cum praesertim, = <hi rend="ital">especially since, the more so because</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum ita sint, quid est quod de ejus civitate dubitetis, praesertim cum aliis quoque civitatibus fuerit adscriptus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur enim tibi hoc non gratificor nescio, praesertim cum his temporibus audacia pro sapientiā liceat uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praesertim vos alium miseritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 7, 16</bibl> (cum praesertim rarely refers to time, with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 6</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n11873.186" n="2" level="3"> Quippe cum represents the conclusion as selfevident, <hi rend="ital">since of course, since obviously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est virtute amabilius, quippe cum propter virtutem etiam eos, quos numquam videmus, quodammodo diligamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ego pecunias istorum, etc., in bonis rebus duxi, quippe cum viderem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 28, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:10" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 57, 10</bibl>.—Sometimes with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> if cum refers to time, <hi rend="ital">when of course, if, of course</hi>: tu vero etiam si reprehenderes ... laetarer: quippe cum in reprehensione est prudentia cum <foreign lang="greek">eu)menei/a|</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11, 2</bibl>.—In later writers with <hi rend="ital">indic., because when</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia experiri necessitas cogebat: quippe cum primas spes fortuna destituit, futura praesentibus videntur esse potiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.187" n="3" level="3"> Utpote cum, <hi rend="ital">seeing that</hi>, explanatory, with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me incommoda valetudo quā jam emerseram, utpote cum sine febri laborassem, tenebat Brundusii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1</bibl> prooem.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 21:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Marc. 21, 2</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n11873.188" n="III" level="1"> Adversative, <hi rend="ital">while, whereas</hi>, denoting a logical contrast with the principal sentence. </sense><sense id="n11873.189" n="A" level="2"> Ante-class., chiefly, </sense><sense id="n11873.190" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei mihi, insanire me aiunt, ultro quom ipsi insaniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.191" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.192" n="a" level="4"> By construction of principal predicate: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi obtemperem quom tu mihi nequeas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit> (4, 1, 50).—</sense><sense id="n11873.193" n="b" level="4"> Independent of construction: edepol, Cupido, quom tam pausillus sis, nimis multum vales, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 421, 25</bibl> (Lübbert conjectures quom <pb n="496" /> <cb n="CUMA" /> tu's tam pausillus): <cit><quote lang="la">eo vos madefacitis, quom ego sim hic siccus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n11873.194" n="B" level="2"> Class. and post-class., always with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11873.195" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de bonis et de caede agatur, testimonium dicturus est is qui et sector est et sicarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 24, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et cum tibi, viro, liceat purpurā in veste stragulā uti, matrem familias tuam purpureum amiculum habere non sines?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:18:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:16:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 2, 16, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.196" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi>: an tu, cum omnem auctoritatem universi ordinis pro pignore putaris, eamque ... concideris, me his existimas pignoribus terreri? Crass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignatur exul aliquid sibi deesse, cum defuerit Scipioni dos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 12:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 12, 7</bibl></cit>; id. Ira, 3, 12, 7; freq. <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> retained, if dependent on preterites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:71:250" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 71, 250</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11873.197" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">imperf. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita, cum maximis eum rebus liberares, perparvam amicitiae culpam relinquebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc Egnatium censores, cum patrem eicerent, retinuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:48:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 48, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum erat V. milium numerus, cum ipsi non amplius octingentos equites haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 53, 227</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 50, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 38 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 49, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:10" default="NO">3, 2, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n11873.198" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socratis ingenium immortalitati scriptis suis Plato tradidit, cum ipse litteram Socrates nullam reliquisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 16, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Val.
